project.name: Protocol-Driven Discovery
project.description: Discover and convert existing contracts (OpenAPI, Postgres, AsyncAPI) into unified protocol manifests with governance-first approach

critical_facts: Enforce clean boundary between protocol contracts and runtime/tooling
Move protocol contracts to /app/packages/protocols with no direct I/O
Move runtime/adapters/CLI to /app/packages/runtime
Add cross-layer lint rule to prevent protocols→runtime coupling
Maintain /app as single build root and docker context
constraints: All protocol contract code must be pure (no direct I/O)
All runtime/adapters/CLI must be separated from protocols
All unit/integration tests must pass with no cross-layer violations
CI builds and tests must execute only from /app
Docker builds must use /app/Dockerfile

achievements: Unified feedback schema for errors, hints, progress
Feedback formatter with suggested fixes and codes
Correlation IDs (trace/span) with <1ms generation
Throttled, hierarchical progress tracker (<2ms overhead)
Workflow + registry adapters wired to events
CLI feedback commands (summaries, errors, hints, traces)
Performance targets achieved (<5ms formatting, <20ms CLI render)
Scaffolding CLI UX consuming feedback system
Templates wired to hint system
Basic protocol scaffolds generated

critical_facts: Replace A2A stubs with production HTTP client
Implement MCP client for real tool execution
Agent discovery via URN resolution and ACM validation
End-to-end multi-agent execution proof
constraints: Use platform HTTP (fetch/undici), no heavy external libs
Framework-agnostic for CLI/server reuse
No vendor SDK lock-in for MCP client
Local runnable scenarios, no internet dependency
achievements: All A2A/MCP stubs replaced with production implementations
Agent discovery and URN resolution working end-to-end
Multi-agent execution proven with real tool execution
CI gate preventing runtime integration regressions
Builder-facing documentation complete for local development

critical_facts: Profile hotspots in URN Resolver, ProtocolGraph, A2A → MCP request paths
Performance targets: Discovery p95 < 1s, MCP p95 < 3s
Steady-state heap < 100 MB under 10-min soak
CI pipeline must complete < 5 min
constraints: No external APM/Prometheus; use internal logging only
Optimization must not reduce correctness or validation accuracy
Single-threaded implementation acceptable
achievements: Performance optimization system implemented with comprehensive metrics
URN Resolver optimized with enhanced caching and pre-warming
ProtocolGraph optimized with batch operations and caching
MCP server performance tracking integrated
Metrics endpoint created for observability
Dockerfile and operator runbook created for production packaging
Performance benchmarks implemented with compliance checking
CI pipeline optimized to complete < 5 minutes with visible metrics
All performance targets met: Discovery p95 < 1s, MCP p95 < 3s, Heap < 100MB

critical_facts: Demonstrate real-world capability through micro-service integration pattern
Improve developer onboarding workflow (time-to-first-result < 2 min)
Create interactive CLI wizard for protocol discovery
Build template project scaffold for multi-tool composition
constraints: Text-based CLI/tutorial only; no UI
Focus on real execution over presentation
Single microservice pattern sufficient for demonstration
achievements: Microservices integration pattern template created with 3 service protocols
Interactive CLI quickstart wizard implemented with non-interactive mode
Developer onboarding workflow optimized to < 2 minutes (achieved 0.21s)
Cross-service dependency validation working end-to-end
Comprehensive quickstart documentation created
Template project scaffold for multi-tool composition
Integration pattern runs locally and passes validation
CLI wizard completes without manual editing

critical_facts: Cross-protocol validation engine operational (≥100 protocols in <1s)
Governance Rules v0.1 implemented: missing schema, cyclic dep, duplicate URN
CLI validate --ecosystem command with structured JSON report output
MCP server API documentation updated with complete tool descriptions
Performance target exceeded: 3.75ms for 105 protocols (target: <1000ms)
constraints: Single-threaded implementation acceptable
Ruleset file-based and reloadable without restart
Must validate ≥100 protocols in <1s

critical_facts: Create microservice-style integration pattern using MCP tools
Improve MCP server error messages and validation feedback
Build interactive tutorial/CLI guide for protocol discovery
End-to-end workflow from startup → first protocol validated < 2 min
constraints: Text-based CLI/tutorial only; no UI
Focus on real execution over presentation

achievements: OpenAPI 3.x parser core implemented with streaming
Endpoint extraction with 95%+ accuracy
Schema extraction with local $ref resolution
Deterministic XXHash-based hashing
Protocol manifest conversion with URNs and provenance
Performance targets met (<1s 10k lines, <100ms/1k lines hashing)
57 tests passing across parser/hash/performance suites
External $ref resolution via HTTP/HTTPS/file:// with caching & retry
LRU cache with 10-minute TTL, exponential backoff (3 retries)
Circular reference detection using Tarjan's algorithm
Dependency graph visualization with cycle path traces
30+ structured error codes across 6 domains (OPENAPI, REF, SCHEMA, NET, PARSE, GENERAL)
Severity levels (ERROR/WARN/INFO) with recovery suggestions
Progress tracking with 11 stages and EventEmitter pattern
Error collection mode for partial results on non-fatal errors
Performance: <500ms external refs (cached <10ms), <50ms circular detection
60+ tests created across error model and integration suites
Registration state machine (DRAFT → REVIEWED → APPROVED → REGISTERED)
Guarded transitions with entry actions and event emission
File-based persistence: atomic state.json + append-only events.log
Optimistic concurrency with compare-and-swap + backoff retries
Comprehensive tests: transitions, lifecycle, concurrency
Registry Writer with catalog + graph atomic updates
URN conflict detection (<5ms) via CatalogIndexAdapter
Batch graph updates (<25ms/node) with placeholder support
RegistrationOrchestrator coordinating full lifecycle
Event-sourced registry operations with recovery capability
Performance targets met: <50ms registry write, <5ms conflict check, <25ms/node graph update
JSON Schema workflow definition with comprehensive validation
WorkflowValidator with semantic validation (dependencies, cycles, compensations)
WorkflowExecutor with event-driven execution model
Sequential execution with dependency resolution
Parallel execution with concurrent branches
Conditional execution with case matching and default fallback
Saga pattern with full/partial compensation policies
Retry policies with exponential backoff
Four example workflows: sequential, parallel, conditional, saga
CLI commands: validate, simulate, examples
28 tests passing with comprehensive coverage
Performance targets met: <50ms validation, <200ms simulation, <10ms parallel overhead

critical_facts: SecretDetector with pattern-based and entropy-based detection
11 credential patterns (AWS, GitHub, Stripe, JWT, SSH, DB URIs)
Entropy threshold 4.5 for base64-like secrets, min length 20 chars
ManifestRedactor with field-based and path-based redaction
createSafeLogger utility for automatic log redaction
Precompiled RegExp patterns for optimal performance
Immutable redaction using structuredClone
Performance: <1ms scan, <5ms large catalog redaction
constraints: Streaming-safe design with minimal allocations
No external dependencies beyond Node.js built-ins
Always return clones, never modify originals
High-entropy detection only on strings ≥20 chars
decisions_made: Dual approach: pattern-based + entropy-based detection
Precompile all RegExp patterns at module load
structuredClone for immutable redaction
Two redaction modes: field-based and path-based
Streaming-safe design for large files
Default placeholder '[REDACTED]' configurable
achievements: SecretDetector class with 11 credential patterns
Entropy detection for high-entropy strings (threshold 4.5)
ManifestRedactor for structured data redaction
createSafeLogger with automatic redaction
31 tests passing (16 unit + 15 integration, 100% pass rate)
Performance targets met: <1ms scan, <5ms large catalog
Integration points: catalog, CLI, logging, governance

critical_facts: URNCatalogIndex with O(1) URN lookups using Map
Secondary indexes for namespace, tags, owner, PII
Dependency graph with Tarjan's cycle detection
Topological sort via Kahn's algorithm for build order
Performance targets: <1ms URN lookup, <10ms tag queries, <50ms graph traversal
Index persistence via JSON save/load
Research validated: Flat hash map approach optimal for <10k artifacts
constraints: Index must fit in memory (<10k artifacts)
All URNs must be valid format
Artifacts immutable once added
Graph operations lazy (compute on demand)
90%+ test coverage required
decisions_made: Use Map and Set for O(1) performance (not objects/arrays)
Kahn's algorithm for topological sort (handles disconnected components)
Tarjan's algorithm for cycle detection with path tracking
JSON Schema validation for index format
Lazy graph computation to minimize memory

critical_facts: TemplateEngine with mustache-style {{variable}} interpolation
ProtocolScaffolder generates manifests, importers, and tests
Template types: API, Data, Event, Semantic protocols

Name validation: format, length, special characters
File collision detection with overwrite prompts
Preview mode with file size display

constraints: Templates must be valid JSON/JS syntax
Variable interpolation supports strings, numbers, objects
Output directories created recursively
Config validation for names (alphanumeric + hyphens/underscores)
Semver version format required
decisions_made: Mustache-style syntax for simplicity and familiarity
Separate templates for each protocol type
ESM modules for new generators (not CommonJS)
CommonJS wrapper for CLI integration
structuredClone not needed (templates are strings)
Type-specific defaults for each protocol
Validation before generation

critical_facts: PRE12 probe validated Babel+jest as executable ESM stack
65 '__dirname/__filename' occurrences need ESM migration
Build root remains /app only
Babel+jest ESM config proven with temp config
MCP smoke tests passed via stdio JSON-RPC
constraints: Node 20 required
babel-jest + presets must be installed
All tests must pass with zero 'require is not defined' errors
Performance budgets: discovery_p95 <1000ms, mcp_p95 <3000ms
CI fast lane must complete in ≤5 minutes

critical_facts: Streaming parser with visitor pattern for >10k line specs
XXHash for deterministic content hashing (100ms/1000 lines target)
Local $ref resolution only (external deferred to B7.1.1)
Canonical JSON serialization for idempotency
Performance target: <1s for 10k line spec
constraints: OpenAPI 3.x only (not 2.0)
No circular reference detection yet
Stream processing required for large files
Memory usage <50MB for typical specs
decisions_made: Streaming first approach for memory efficiency
XXHash over SHA-256 for performance (non-cryptographic use)
Local $refs only, defer external to B7.1.1
Focus on OpenAPI 3.x, skip 2.0
Canonical JSON for deterministic hashing

M12.2.name: MCP Server E2E and Agent Runtime

special_instructions: All build artifacts go under /app directory
Maintain zero dependencies in core protocols
Use URN format: urn:proto:<kind>:<authority>/<id>[@<version>]
Always validate manifests before operations
Include confidence scores for heuristics
Update all documentation when mission completes
Use Graphology for all graph operations
CRITICAL: Lazy load @asyncapi/parser (2.85MB) - import only when needed
Multi-tier binding detection (priority cascade, not aggregation)
Three-tier PII confidence scoring (definite/potential/contextual)
Semantic URN format separates identifier from version
API routes before static middleware in Express
RAF and debounce for 60fps UI updates
Pattern detection: confidence reflects signal strength, not aggregation
PII + retries without DLQ = error severity (compliance risk)
Pattern-driven governance: leverage B4.2 patterns, no re-detection
Generated code must be idiomatic TypeScript
PII masking in generated consumers for safe logging
DLQ routing only when manifest declares DLQ
Protocol-specific client libraries: KafkaJS, amqplib, MQTT.js
